meanings.definition: The quality or style of being theatrical.
meanings.sent1: Her theatricalism on stage captivated the audience.
meanings.sent2: The actor's theatricalism brought the character to life.
meanings.sent3: The theatricalism of her storytelling made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: His theatricalism was like a colorful painting on a blank canvas.
meanings.sent5: The theatricalism of the performance left a lasting impression.

meanings.definition: The use of exaggerated gestures or behavior.
meanings.sent1: His theatricalism in the play was over the top.
meanings.sent2: The comedian's theatricalism had the crowd roaring with laughter.
meanings.sent3: The child's theatricalism while playing pretend was adorable.
meanings.sent4: The theatricalism of the mime artist was truly captivating.
meanings.sent5: Her theatricalism in the dance routine was graceful and expressive.

meanings.definition: The practice or art of producing or staging plays.
meanings.sent1: The theatricalism of the theater group impressed the critics.
meanings.sent2: Learning about theatricalism in drama class was exciting.
meanings.sent3: The school's theatricalism in organizing the play was commendable.
meanings.sent4: The theatricalism of the director transformed the stage into a magical world.
meanings.sent5: His theatricalism in directing the play brought out the best in the actors.
